name: Upcycle House
subtitle: Denmark's pioneering 86% upcycled demonstration house - proving circular construction viable at market price
data_source: Realdania By & Byg - MiniCO2 Husene program documentation

executive_summary.headline: 86% CO2 reduction using 86% recycled/upcycled materials - built at standard market price
key_achievements: 86% CO2 reduction vs 2013 Danish reference house
Built at market price (~13,000 DKK/m² = 1,700,000 DKK total)
Two 40-foot shipping containers as primary structure
Recycled steel screw pile foundation (fully relocatable)
Facade: flattened aluminum cans + Richlite paper composite
Cork floor tiles from champagne cork offcuts
10+ years of proven durability (privately occupied since 2013)
executive_summary.why_flagship: Upcycle House was Denmark's first full-scale demonstration that circular construction could achieve radical CO2 reduction (86%) while matching conventional costs. Ten years of occupancy has validated material durability and livability. The project established Lendager Group's upcycling methodology that scaled to Resource Rows, UN17 Village, and beyond.
executive_summary.why_tier: Completeness score 85/100 (Grade A). Comprehensive Realdania documentation with verified metrics, cost comparison, 10-year track record, and detailed material breakdown.

program.name: MiniCO2 Husene
program.description: Demonstration program proving low-carbon housing achievable at market price

materials.description: Two 40-foot ISO shipping containers form primary structural frame
materials.processing: Containers externally insulated with paper insulation and vapor barrier to avoid thermal bridges

materials.description: Recycled steel screw piles instead of concrete slab
materials.design_feature: Fully relocatable - building can be moved without foundation demolition

materials.description: Paper insulation from recycled newspapers blown into wall and roof
Flattened aluminum beverage cans as facade cladding element
materials.processing: Cans flattened and arranged as decorative/protective cladding

materials.description: Richlite panels - paper waste + bio-resin composite
materials.processing: Compressed paper waste with bio-based resin binder

materials.description: Kitchen floor tiles from compressed champagne cork offcuts
materials.processing: Cork offcuts pressed into durable floor tiles

materials.description: Bathroom floor from recycled glass terrazzo
Interior walls and ceiling from formaldehyde-free OSB panels
Windows from production overruns and faulty batches - double/triple glazed
Thermal mass wall from water-filled jerry cans for passive temperature regulation
materials.design_feature: Water mass creates thermal buffer for passive heating/cooling

materials.description: Technopor/granulated foam waste from packaging and ice rinks

validation.durability_proof: All experimental materials have proven durable after 10+ years

economics.cost_insight: Higher design/engineering costs offset by lower material costs

key_insights: 86% recycled materials achievable at market price
User behavior impacts energy performance more than technical specifications
10 years of occupancy validates durability of experimental materials
success_factors: Screw pile foundation enables future relocation
challenges_encountered: Thermal bridge management with metal container structure
Sourcing consistent quality recycled materials at scale
Design/engineering complexity for novel material combinations
recommendations: External insulation critical for container buildings
Manufacturing waste streams offer consistent quality

narrative.driver: Realdania sought to prove that drastic CO2 reduction in housing could be achieved at standard market prices - challenging the assumption that sustainable building must cost more.
narrative.approach: Creative material sourcing from industrial waste streams. Shipping containers as structure, recycled steel foundation, newspaper insulation, flattened beverage cans on facade. All components selected for proven durability.
narrative.significance: First Danish full-scale demonstration that 86% recycled materials could match conventional costs. Established methodology scaled to Resource Rows, UN17 Village, and Lendager's subsequent projects.
narrative.legacy: Ten years of successful occupancy has validated all experimental materials. Model for circular housing globally.
